parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the Takata airbag can cause serious injury or death in the event of an accident, and the lack of available replacement parts is leaving vehicles in an unsafe condition.
symptoms: inability to use front passenger seat

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Inadequate Response to Takata Airbag Recall
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The manufacturer's inadequate response to the recall is leaving vehicle owners without a safe and reliable solution, causing inconvenience, and affecting the resale value of the vehicle.
symptoms: Lack of communication from the manufacturer
inability to obtain a rental vehicle

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the airbag to deploy in the event of an accident can cause serious injury or death.
symptoms: Airbag did not deploy in an accident
injury or death resulted from the accident

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the brakes can cause accidents, injuries, and fatalities, as well as damage to the vehicle and other property.
symptoms: and hits other vehicles or objects.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The paint defect can lead to premature wear and tear on the vehicle's exterior, reducing its value and appearance.
symptoms: The paint peels off in large sheets
especially on the roof and hood
without any connection to vehicle damage or weather.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Excessive oil consumption can lead to premature engine wear, engine failure, and even engine fires, which can cause accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: The need to add oil frequently (every 500-800 miles)
no visible smoke from engine or exhaust when cold or hot.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Engine Failure due to Piston Ring Wear
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Worn piston rings can cause excessive oil consumption, leading to engine failure, and potentially, engine fires.
symptoms: smoke emitting from the rear of the vehicle.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Engine Fire due to Oil Leak
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: An oil leak can cause an engine fire, leading to catastrophic engine failure, accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: smoke emitting from the rear of the vehicle
